events.title: Surrender at Yorktown Ends Major Combat of the American Revolutionary War
events.description: British General Cornwallis surrendered to American and French forces at the Siege of Yorktown, effectively ending major military operations in the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of the end of British rule in the American colonies, leading to American independence.

events.title: Napoleon's Retreat from Moscow Begins
events.description: After the disastrous French invasion of Russia, Napoleon Bonaparte began his retreat from Moscow, which would lead to massive losses for the French army.
events.significance: This retreat marked a turning point in the Napoleonic Wars, leading to the eventual downfall of Napoleon.

events.title: Battle of Tarawa Ends
events.description: The United States secured victory in the Battle of Tarawa after fierce fighting in the Pacific Theater of World War II.
events.significance: This was a crucial battle that marked American advances in the Pacific, testing amphibious assault tactics.

events.title: Black Monday Stock Market Crash
events.description: On October 19, 1987, global stock markets crashed, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average falling by 22.6% in a single day.
events.significance: This remains the largest one-day percentage decline in stock market history, leading to changes in market regulations and trading safeguards.

events.title: John F. Kennedy Elected President of the United States
events.description: Although election day was in November, on October 19, 1960, JFK was actively campaigning and emerging as a frontrunner, marking the beginning of the final intense phase of the U.S. presidential race.
events.significance: This election led to the youngest elected president in U.S. history and significant political and social changes during the 1960s.
